title: Chinese Embassy donates Christmas gifts to Bolivian impoverished families in December 2021
description: On December 21, 2021, Chinese Ambassador to Bolivia, Huang Yazhong, made a donation of Christmas gifts to be given to impoverished Bolivian families. Bolivian Senate representatives received the donation. The gifts consisted of packaged pasta and cereal.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates Christmas gifts to Bolivian impoverished families in December 2021

# Description
On December 21, 2021, Chinese Ambassador to Bolivia, Huang Yazhong, made a donation of Christmas gifts to be given to impoverished Bolivian families. Bolivian Senate representatives received the donation. The gifts consisted of packaged pasta and cereal.
justification: Project is focused on social welfare and food aid without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of Christmas gifts (packaged pasta and cereal) to impoverished families, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese Consulate General donates surgical masks to Santa Cruz Police in March 2021
description: On March 2nd, 2021, the Chinese Consulate General donated 15,000 surgical masks to the Santa Cruz police department. Consul General Wang Jialei handed over the supplies to deputy commander of the Santa Cruz Police, Marcelo Flores.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact

description: On December 16, 2021, the Chinese Consul General of Santa Cruz, Wang Jialei, handed over nasal antigen rapid detection reagents to Juan Carlos Montaño Arias, Mayor of Warnes, Bolivia.

title: Sinopharm donates laboratory equipment to Bolivia in June 2021
description: In June 2021, China National Pharmaceutical Group Corporation (Sinopharm) donated laboratory equipment to the Bolivian National Institute of Health Laboratories (INLASA). The donation arrived at Jorge Wilstermann International Airport in Cochabamba on June 21, along with a purchased batch of Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccines. The donation was for the purpose of assisting Bolivia in its fight against COVID-19. The laboratory equipment was to be used for conducting PCR and blood analysis, although what exact equipment was donated is unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Sinopharm donates laboratory equipment to Bolivia in June 2021

# Description
In June 2021, China National Pharmaceutical Group Corporation (Sinopharm) donated laboratory equipment to the Bolivian National Institute of Health Laboratories (INLASA). The donation arrived at Jorge Wilstermann International Airport in Cochabamba on June 21, along with a purchased batch of Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccines. The donation was for the purpose of assisting Bolivia in its fight against COVID-19. The laboratory equipment was to be used for conducting PCR and blood analysis, although what exact equipment was donated is unclear.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and disease control, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Laboratory equipment donation for COVID-19 testing, healthcare sector focus

title: China Eximbank provides EUR 189.4 million loan for 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project
description: On July 28, 2011, the Government of the Republic of Srpska granted a concession to HE DABAR d.o.o. Trebinje (also known as Hidroelektrana na Trebišnjici and HET) — a project company and special purpose vehicle — for the construction and operation of the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant. Then, in July 2013, China Eximbank signaled its willingness to provide a buyer’s credit loan to finance 85% of the cost of the commercial contract (85% x EUR 179.9 million = EUR 152.9 million) for this project. The expected borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: 3% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 4-year grace period.   Then, on December 7, 2015, the Republic of Srpska and China International Water & Electric Corporation (CWE) signed an MOU regarding the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Project. However, this agreement did not result in the signing of an EPC contract. Almost five years later, on May 4, 2020, Energy China Gezhouba Group and HPP Dabar L.L.C. — a wholly owned subsidiary of HET — signed an ‘EPC + F’ contract (worth approximately EUR 222,834,120 or RMB 1.7 billion) for the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Project. Then, on December 31, 2021, Hidroelektrana Dabar (HPP Dabar) — a special purpose vehicle that is owned by HET — signed an 189,409,002 loan agreement with China Eximbank for the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project. The borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: a 20-year maturity, a 4-year grace period, and interest rate of EURIBOR plus a 2.3% margin, a 0.5% commitment fee, a 0.5% management fee, and a Sinosure insurance fee of 6.42% of the value of the sum of loan's principal and interest (EUR 15,649,101.14). The loan was collateralized. However, as additional credit enhancements, the Republic of Srpska issued a government repayment guarantee and the borrower purchased a 20-year credit insurance policy from Sinosure. The proceeds of the loan are to be used by the borrower to finance approximately 85% of the cost of a EUR 222.8 million commercial contract that Hidroelektrana Dabar (HPP Dabar)  and China Gezhouba Group Company Limited signed on May 4, 2020.   The purpose of the project is to construct the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant located in the city of Trebinje within the Republic of Srpska. The power plant, which will be part of the planned Gornji Horizonti hydropower complex, is expected to generate 250 GW per year upon completion. In January 2022, the state-owned power utility Elektroprivreda Republike Srpske (ERS) announced plans for a EUR 218 million capital increase in its subsidiary Hidroelektrane na Trebišnjici (HET) in order to raise money for the construction of the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant. However, ERS insisted that the capital injection would not result in a takeover of HET.
staff_comments: 1. Milbank LLP advised the lender.  See https://www.milbank.com/en/news/milbank-advises-export-import-bank-of-china-on-financing-of-central-and-eastern-europes-largest-hydro-ipp.html2. The largest shareholders of HET are ERS (65%), the Pension Reserve Fund Management Company of the Republic of Srpska (10%), the investment fund management company Kristal invest (5,3%), and the Republic of Srpska Restitution Fund (5%). 3. Evidence of the issuance of a government repayment guarantee can be found at http://sluzbenilist.ba/page/akt/p09Jc0xogztz5k76kjn45hQM=.4. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 2.3% to average 6-month EURIBOR in December 2021 (-0.545%).
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides EUR 189.4 million loan for 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project

# Description
On July 28, 2011, the Government of the Republic of Srpska granted a concession to HE DABAR d.o.o. Trebinje (also known as Hidroelektrana na Trebišnjici and HET) — a project company and special purpose vehicle — for the construction and operation of the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant. Then, in July 2013, China Eximbank signaled its willingness to provide a buyer’s credit loan to finance 85% of the cost of the commercial contract (85% x EUR 179.9 million = EUR 152.9 million) for this project. The expected borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: 3% interest rate, 15-year maturity, and 4-year grace period.   Then, on December 7, 2015, the Republic of Srpska and China International Water & Electric Corporation (CWE) signed an MOU regarding the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Project. However, this agreement did not result in the signing of an EPC contract. Almost five years later, on May 4, 2020, Energy China Gezhouba Group and HPP Dabar L.L.C. — a wholly owned subsidiary of HET — signed an ‘EPC + F’ contract (worth approximately EUR 222,834,120 or RMB 1.7 billion) for the 159MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Project. Then, on December 31, 2021, Hidroelektrana Dabar (HPP Dabar) — a special purpose vehicle that is owned by HET — signed an 189,409,002 loan agreement with China Eximbank for the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant Construction Project. The borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: a 20-year maturity, a 4-year grace period, and interest rate of EURIBOR plus a 2.3% margin, a 0.5% commitment fee, a 0.5% management fee, and a Sinosure insurance fee of 6.42% of the value of the sum of loan's principal and interest (EUR 15,649,101.14). The loan was collateralized. However, as additional credit enhancements, the Republic of Srpska issued a government repayment guarantee and the borrower purchased a 20-year credit insurance policy from Sinosure. The proceeds of the loan are to be used by the borrower to finance approximately 85% of the cost of a EUR 222.8 million commercial contract that Hidroelektrana Dabar (HPP Dabar)  and China Gezhouba Group Company Limited signed on May 4, 2020.   The purpose of the project is to construct the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant located in the city of Trebinje within the Republic of Srpska. The power plant, which will be part of the planned Gornji Horizonti hydropower complex, is expected to generate 250 GW per year upon completion. In January 2022, the state-owned power utility Elektroprivreda Republike Srpske (ERS) announced plans for a EUR 218 million capital increase in its subsidiary Hidroelektrane na Trebišnjici (HET) in order to raise money for the construction of the 159.9 MW Dabar Hydroelectric Power Plant. However, ERS insisted that the capital injection would not result in a takeover of HET.
justification: Primary purpose is renewable energy generation through hydropower
evidence: 159.9 MW hydroelectric power plant, expected to generate 250 GW per year of renewable energy

title: China Eximbank provides a EUR 300 million loan for First Section of Banja Luka-Prijedor-Novi Grad Motorway Project (Linked to Project ID#66452)
description: In December 2018, SDHS-CSI BH d.o.o.Banja Luka (SDHS-CSI BH) — a special purpose vehicle and wholly owned subsidiary of China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Group (CSI) — signed a concession agreement with the Government of the Republic of Srpska for the First Section of the Banja Luka-Prijedor-Novi Grad Motorway Project. Under the terms of this agreement, SDHS-CSI BH is responsible for designing, financing, building, managing and maintaining a 42 km motorway section that runs from Banja Luka to Prijedor. The motorway will have two lanes in both directions, a traffic island, and an emergency lane.   According to the project design, the highway section will consist of seven tunnels and 35 bridges, three interchanges and the infrastructure for a closed system of the toll payment as well as the system for traffic safety management and control. This project represents the first highway concession project ever undertaken in the Republic of Srpska. The concession agreement lasts for 33 years, including a 3 year construction period. The EUR 297 million project is being implemented on a public-private partnership (PPP) basis and financed according to an unknown debt-to-equity ratio.   During the period in which it operates the motorway, the concessionaire (SDHS-CSI BH) will pay an annual fee of EUR 32.5 million to the Government of the Republic of Srpska. China Eximbank signaled its willingness to finance the project in 2018, and the project was originally expected to reach financial close (FC) during the summer of 2020. However, FC was not achieved according to the original timetable due to unexpected delays. The project’s groundbreaking ceremony ultimately took place on November 6, 2021.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the 42km Banja Luka-Prijedor Motorway PPP Project. The Chinese project title is 承建的巴尼亚卢卡-普里耶多尔高速公路项目 or 和国巴尼亚卢卡-普里耶多尔-诺维格莱. 德高速公路项目. 2. More research is needed to be undertaken to identify the precise face value of the China Eximbank loan commitment for this project. For the time being, AidData assumes (conservatively) that the EUR 297 million project is being financing according to a debt-to-equity ratio of 70:30, which implies that the face value of the China Eximbank loan is EUR 207.9 million. Meanwhile, 'China’s focus means Bosnian economy no longer feeling left behind' published in May 2019 before financial close, suggests that the loan had a face value of EUR 300 million. This issue warrants further investigation. 3. The loan commitment date is another key piece of information that still needs to be identified.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides a EUR 300 million loan for First Section of Banja Luka-Prijedor-Novi Grad Motorway Project (Linked to Project ID#66452)

# Description
In December 2018, SDHS-CSI BH d.o.o.Banja Luka (SDHS-CSI BH) — a special purpose vehicle and wholly owned subsidiary of China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Group (CSI) — signed a concession agreement with the Government of the Republic of Srpska for the First Section of the Banja Luka-Prijedor-Novi Grad Motorway Project. Under the terms of this agreement, SDHS-CSI BH is responsible for designing, financing, building, managing and maintaining a 42 km motorway section that runs from Banja Luka to Prijedor. The motorway will have two lanes in both directions, a traffic island, and an emergency lane.   According to the project design, the highway section will consist of seven tunnels and 35 bridges, three interchanges and the infrastructure for a closed system of the toll payment as well as the system for traffic safety management and control. This project represents the first highway concession project ever undertaken in the Republic of Srpska. The concession agreement lasts for 33 years, including a 3 year construction period. The EUR 297 million project is being implemented on a public-private partnership (PPP) basis and financed according to an unknown debt-to-equity ratio.   During the period in which it operates the motorway, the concessionaire (SDHS-CSI BH) will pay an annual fee of EUR 32.5 million to the Government of the Republic of Srpska. China Eximbank signaled its willingness to finance the project in 2018, and the project was originally expected to reach financial close (FC) during the summer of 2020. However, FC was not achieved according to the original timetable due to unexpected delays. The project’s groundbreaking ceremony ultimately took place on November 6, 2021.
justification: Motorway construction project with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 42 km motorway section with tunnels, bridges, and toll infrastructure; no mention of renewable energy or energy efficiency components

title: Chinese Embassy provides personal protective equipment to Mostar City Health Center in Bosnia and Herzegovina in March 2021
description: On March 30, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated personal protective equipment to Mostar City Health Center in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The equipment included protective suits, masks and other unspecified items. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Bosnia and Herzegovina. These supplies have an estimated value of around 7,700 Euros or 15,000 convertible marks according to FENA.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ji Ping, the Chinese Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina; the Mayor of Mostar, Mario Kordic; and the Director of the Health Center, Kristina Bevanda; attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.
staff_comments: 1. The estimated worth of the supplies given by FENA is the basis for the transaction amount listed in this entry.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides personal protective equipment to Mostar City Health Center in Bosnia and Herzegovina in March 2021

# Description
On March 30, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated personal protective equipment to Mostar City Health Center in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The equipment included protective suits, masks and other unspecified items. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Bosnia and Herzegovina. These supplies have an estimated value of around 7,700 Euros or 15,000 convertible marks according to FENA.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ji Ping, the Chinese Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina; the Mayor of Mostar, Mario Kordic; and the Director of the Health Center, Kristina Bevanda; attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Personal protective equipment donation, healthcare sector focus, COVID-19 response

title: Chinese government provides 50,000 COVID-19 vaccines to Bosnia and Herzegovina in April 2021
description: On April 29, 2021, the Chinese government provided 50,000 doses of the Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine to Bosnia and Herzegovina. According to the Chinese Embassy in Bosnia and Herzegovina, this donation represents cooperation between China and Bosnia and Herzegovina as well as China's commitment to helping the country overcome COVID-19.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation in Sarajevo, the capital city of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Ji Ping, the Chinese Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina, attended the ceremony and delivered a speech as did Minister of Civil Affairs of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Ankica Gudeljevic.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government provides 50,000 COVID-19 vaccines to Bosnia and Herzegovina in April 2021

# Description
On April 29, 2021, the Chinese government provided 50,000 doses of the Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine to Bosnia and Herzegovina. According to the Chinese Embassy in Bosnia and Herzegovina, this donation represents cooperation between China and Bosnia and Herzegovina as well as China's commitment to helping the country overcome COVID-19.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation in Sarajevo, the capital city of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Ji Ping, the Chinese Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina, attended the ceremony and delivered a speech as did Minister of Civil Affairs of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Ankica Gudeljevic.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: COVID-19 vaccine donation, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-pandemic supplies to the Foundation for Shared Societies and Values of Bosnia and Herzegovina in May 2021
description: On May 18, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided anti-pandemic supplies to the Foundation for Shared Societies and Values, Sarajevo. This donation was made in response to the severity of COVID-19 in Bosnia and Herzegovina and served as reciprocation for the Foundation for Common Society and Values’ donation of masks to the Chinese Embassy earlier in the year.  The specific type of supplies and their amount, as well as the monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ji Ping, China’s Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Zlatko Lagumdžija, the Chairman of the Foundation for Common Society and Values ​​of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the former Chairman of the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina attended the ceremony. After delivering a speech, Ji Ping donated the anti-epidemic materials to the Foundation.
combined_text:

# Description

This donation was made in response to the severity of COVID-19 in Bosnia and Herzegovina and served as reciprocation for the Foundation for Common Society and Values’ donation of masks to the Chinese Embassy earlier in the year.  The specific type of supplies and their amount, as well as the monetary value of this donation are unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ji Ping, China’s Ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Zlatko Lagumdžija, the Chairman of the Foundation for Common Society and Values ​​of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the former Chairman of the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina attended the ceremony. After delivering a speech, Ji Ping donated the anti-epidemic materials to the Foundation.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for pandemic response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Anti-pandemic supplies donation, health sector focus, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-pandemic supplies to Zenica State Hospital in December 2021
description: On  December 27, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided anti-pandemic supplies and medical equipment to Zenica Cantonal Hospital in Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina. The donation included an ultrasound machine, 5,000 protective masks, and 1,000 medical coverall suits. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The estimated value of this donation is 50,000 BAM, according to FENA.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation.  Miao Dake, the Political Counselor of the Chinese Embassy in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Mirnes Bašić, the Governor of Zenica-Doboj State, the Minister of Health of the State, and the Director of Zenica State Hospital attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.
staff_comments: 1. Based on the exchange rate of the time, 50,000 convertible marks was equal to 29,000 USD at the time. This has been put as the value of the donation.
combined_text:

# Description
